Isolated Schools Blog

Posted on June 1, 2017

I recently published a paper called Lonely Schools in Educational Research on the relationship between geographic isolation and pupil’s academic attainment in English secondary schools. That paper (which you can download here with eprint available here) used the percentage of all students and disadvantaged students achieving 5+ GCSEs at KS4, including English and maths from 2013-2015, as its dependent variable. That analysis identifed a correlation between lower GCSE attainment rates by disadvantaged pupils at secondary schools in more geographically isolated areas, when controlling for other school demographic, previous attainment and location variables.
